message:
Changing proxy in internet options is not enough!:
netsh winhttp import proxy source=ie

data.message: Would you please give more context of what you're trying to do?

:) if your company has a proxy (TMG or ISA) and you set the proxy configuration through the internet option you might found windows update not working and essential security also not updating so to solve this you run the mentioned command to redirect any request to the proxy you set before. Because not evey requests goes though the proxy server even if set it in the internet option

You can set the HTTP_PROXY environment variable to http://username:password@proxy_ip:port

This will tell Windows to tunnel all HTTP traffic to the proxy
Right-click on my computer -> properties, click "Advanced System Settings", press "Environment Variables" and add the HTTP_PROXY environment variable
Does this mean I have to enable it from internet options?

for mine, does this formula right?
http://domain\username:passowrdWithDot@proxyIp:port

When you set HTTP_PROXY, you don't need to set internet options from IE

I believe that HTTP_PROXY works on Linux too
